title: Endometrial cancer
summary: Endometrial cancer is a cancer that arises from the endometrium (the lining of the uterus or womb).[1] It is the result of the abnormal growth of cells that have the ability to invade or spread to other parts of the body.[8] The first sign is most often vaginal bleeding not associated with a menstrual period.[1] Other symptoms include pain with urination, pain during sexual intercourse, or pelvic pain.[1] Endometrial cancer occurs most commonly after menopause.[2]
